title.narrative: Power of Voices FAIR for ALL SOMO

description.narrative: Power of Voices FAIR for ALL developing capacity of civil society; advocacy and lobby to influence for fair agricultural and extractive value chains worldwide. SOMO’s contribution to FAIR for ALL is its 45 years of experience in investigating the adverseimpact ofmultinationals. SOMO works in collaboration with a wide range of partners and affected groups. For FAIR for ALL, SOMO will provide supply chain or value chain analyses that show which actors are linked to agricultural value chains and extractiveindustries, and their adverse impacts. The impact of the financial sector on value chains and tax avoidance by MNE’s are examples of research that SOMO will undertake in cooperation with partners in the focus countries. During this partnership, SOMO willadd to this the concept of a“wealth chain” to provide more insight into the question where in value chains wealth is extracted and how this contributes to inequality. SOMO also supports communities who seek justice and remedy and as a host of networks such as OECD Watch, the MVO Platform and Tax Justice. As an internationally recognized authority on multinationals, SOMO is involved in many efforts to regulate the financial and private sector at the national, the EU and the international level.

participating-org.narrative: SOMO is an independent, not-for-profit research and network organization working on social, ecological and economic issues related to sustainable development. Since 1973, the organization investigates multinational corporations and the consequences of their activities for people and the environment around the world.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
